questions.text: Which of the following has inhibitory effect on lactotrope cells of pituitary?
Which of the following is not because of prolactin?

A 36-year-old man presented with headaches, visual impairment and infertility. Clinically, the patient was found to have hypogonadism and bitemporal hemianopia. A MRI demonstrated a pituitary tumour 1.5 cm in diameter and blood tests revealed a serum prolactin of 600mcg/L (reference range < 20 mcg/L). What should be the first line treatment?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Cabergoline Medical therapy for pituitary tumors is highly specific and depends on tumor type. For prolactinomas, dopamine agonists are the treatment of choice.

questions.text: A 34-year-old male patient experiencing impotence was found to have increased prolactin and low testosterone concentrations. Patient is a known case of migraine and takes verapamil as prophylaxis and sumatriptan for acute attack since last 10 years. Magnetic resonance imaging showed a 6-mm lesion consistent with a pituitary microadenoma. What should be the next line of management?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Withhold verapamil and observe

questions.text: Which of the following drug is not associated with hyperprolactinemia?

A 46-year male comes to OPD complaining of tiredness. He has noticed weight loss over the last six months and irritation of the tip of his penis which appears inflamed on examination. He mentions he has been visiting the toilet more often than usual and feeling thirsty. The most appropriate investigation would be:

A 30-year-old obese female complains of tiredness. She has recently given birth to a healthy baby boy. However, she is becoming more reliant on her partner for support as she always feels exhausted and often becomes depressed. The patient has a poor appetite and often does not finish her meals, despite this she has gained 7 kg in the last 3 weeks. She also complains of constipation, excessive sleep & can not tolerate AC in room. The most likely diagnosis is:

A 28-year-old woman has noticed a change in her appearance; most notably her clothes do not fit properly and are especially tight around the waist. Her face appears flushed and more rounded than usual, despite exercising regularly and eating healthily her weight has steadily increased over the last 3 weeks. On visiting her GP, he notices her blood pressure has increased since her last visit and she has bruises on her arm. She is especially worried about a brain tumour. The most appropriate investigation would be:

A 42-year-old man presents with pain, burning & tingling in right index finger & thumb. On enquiry patient gives history of difficulty in sleeping. He reports feeling increasingly tired and general weakness which he attributes to his poor sleep pattern. Additionally, the patient has noticed he has gained weight and sweats very easily. On examination, the patient has coarse facial features & weakness when gripping objects with right hand. The most likely diagnosis is:

A 48-year-old female presents with decreased sleep, visual disturbances & loose motions. In addition, she becomes breathless very easily and experiences palpitations. On examination, raised, painless lesions are observed on the front of her shins and finger clubbing. The most likely diagnosis is:

46-year-old female presents with swelling in her neck which she has noticed in the last 2 weeks. On enquiry patient also gives history of constipation & weight gain. The least appropriate investigation will be:

choices.text: Measure plasma cortisol after giving injection CRH
Measure plasma ACTH after giving injection CRH

questions.text: A 46 year female complains of giddiness, weakness and feeling light-headed. She works as a teacher and most frequently experiences this when standing up from chair. She has never fainted. The patient has lost 6 kg, but attributes this to eating more healthily. She has noticed darkening of her palms. The most appropriate investigation is:

choices.text: Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) brain for pituitary

questions.text: A 24 year old female presents with a 6 to 8 weeks history of polyuria and extreme thirst. The patient denies and burning micturition. The patient does not have weight loss and no change in food habit. The most appropriate investigation is:

A 74-year-old man admitted for fever, cough & breathlessness. After 2 days he developed confusion & was not able to recognise his family members. Blood results are as follows: Sodium 123 meq/L, Potassium 3.4 meq/L, Glucose (fasting) 100 mg/dl Urine osmolality 1189 mmol/L. MRI brain normal. Chest x ray film attached. The most likely diagnosis is:

A 26-year-old woman undergoes abortion in 9 weeks of pregnancy. Next day she developed severe headache, sweating & blurring of vision. On examination her blood pressure was 70/30 mmHg, heart rate is 148 bpm regular. Her laboratory tests are notable for glucose of 49 mg/dL, Hb-11.2 mg/dl, with normal haematocrit and white blood cell count. Which of the following drug is most likely to reverse her hypotension?
Which of the following can not differentiate diabetic ketoacidosis from hyperosmolar hyperglycemic state

choices.text: Morning hyperglycemia due to insufficient insulin
Morning hypoglycemia due to excess insulin

questions.text: Which of the following statements about Somogyi effect is true?

choices.text: Patient presents with ketoacidosis, but do not require long-term exogenous insulin therapy.
Defect in beta cells leading to hyperglycemia
Acute onset of type 1 diabetes because of viral infection of the islets
The development of a type 1 diabetes phenotype after 40 years of age

questions.text: “KETOSIS-PRONE DIABETES” means:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

A. Patient presents with ketoacidosis, but do not require long-term exogenous insulin therapy.

B. Defect in beta cells leading to hyperglycemia -MODY

C. Acute onset of type 1 diabetes because of viral infection of the islets-FULMINANT DIABETES

D. The development of a type 1 diabetes phenotype after 40 years of age-

The development of a type 2 diabetes phenotype before puberty ATYPICAL DIABETES.

questions.text: Which of the following statement about pseudohypoparathyroidism II is false?

A 12 year old child having tingling sensations all over body and history of recurrent muscle cramps without any skeletal deformity visit OPD. Lab investigations are suggestive of hypocalcemia with hyperphosphatemia, increased serum PTH level and urinary c-AMP decreased. Which of the following is most probable diagnosis?
Which of the following is not a feature of primary hyperparathyroidism?
Which of the following is not a feature of hypercalcemia?
The occurrence of hypothyroidism following administration of potassium iodide to a case of toxic adenoma is known as:
Choose the best Lab value for a patient of SIADH

choices.text: Trans-sphenoidal surgical resection of pituitary adenoma

questions.text: A 46 year old male came to OPD with chief complaints of central obesity, purple stretch marks on abdomen, weight gain and redness of cheeks. No history of any drug. On examination BP 160/90 mmhg, proximal muscle weakness present. Blood investigations are RBS 334 mg/dl, serum potassium 2.9 mcg/L, serum ACTH level is decreased and serum cortisol level is increased. MRI brain showed pituitary adenoma. What should next appropriate step?
Which of the following can not differentiate Cushing’s disease with Ectopic ACTH secreting tumor?

A 50 year old male who is follow up case of pulmonary koch’s brought to emergency department in unconscious state. On examination pulse is feeble, BP unrecordable & RBS 46 mg/dl. On enquiry relative gave history of fever, loose motions & vomiting since last 3 days. Which of the following drug is not required?

A 36 year old male having drug resistant hypertension coming to OPD with severe headache. Blood reports showing hypokalemia on further investigations serum aldosterone level was increased with decreased plasma renin activity. Diagnosis of primary hyperaldosteronism is confirmed by saline infusion test. CT adrenal is normal. Which of the following is next best step in management?

choices.text: Aldosterone secretion is controlled by Renin
Aldosterone secretion is controlled by ACTH
Hypertension with hypokalemia is characteristic feature

questions.text: Which of the following is false regarding Glucocorticoid Remediable Aldosteronism?

choices.text: Hypertension with hypokalemia is characteristic feature

questions.text: Which of the following is false regarding SAME?
Which of the following defect is correctly matched with type of MODY?

choices.text: Fasting blood sugar between 100 to 125 mg/dl
Random blood glucose between 130 to 180 mg/dl with symptoms of diabetes

questions.text: Which of the following condition is considered as a PREDIABETIC?
Fructoseamine assay measures
Which of the following treatment goal of diabetes is false?
Which of the following is longest acting insulin?
Name of the sign shown in the figure
Conn’s syndrome is associated with all, except:
In a patient if administration of exogenous vasopressin does not increase the osmolality of urine the likely cause is:
Mainstay of treatment of nephrogenic diabetes insipidus is:
All are seen in DKA except:

A 44 year old male having drug resistant hypertension coming to OPD with severe headache. Blood reports showing hypokalemia on further investigations serum aldosterone level was increased with decreased plasma renin activity. Diagnosis of primary hyperaldosteronism is confirmed by saline infusion test. CT adrenal showed right adrenal adenoma. Which of the following is next best step in management?
Which of the following is not used in treatment of Syndrome of inappropriate ADH secretion?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C) 

Conivaptan

It is not approved for SIADH.

questions.text: All of the following can cause pituitary apoplexy except:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Hyperthyroidism Diabetes mellitus, Sickle cell anemia, Hypertension ans Sheehan’s syndrome are associated with pituitary apoplexy.

choices.text: Increase in serum osmolality and decrease in urine osmolality

questions.text: A 24-year-old female meets with an accident with resultant transaction of the pituitary stalk; what will NOT occur:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Hyperpigmentation

As CRH will decrease ACTH will also decrease. ACTH stimulates melanocytes.

b. Increase in serum osmolality and decrease in urine osmolality – because of central Diabetes insipidus

c. Galactorrhoea because of Hyperprolactinemia due to decreased Dopamine secretion from hypothalamus to pituitary

d. Intolerance to cold – Because of Hypothyroidism due to decreased TRH

questions.text: A 30-year-old male complains of loss of erection; he has low testosterone and high prolactin level in blood; What is the likely diagnosis:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Pituitary adenoma

It is case of Prolactinoma. As PRL inhibits GnRH.

questions.text: In a patient suffering from thyrotoxicosis the thyroid scintigraphy is as shown in the figure the most likely diagnosis is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Toxic Multinodular Goitre

Multiple hyperactive nodules can be seen in figure.

questions.text: A 66-year-old woman brought to the emergency department with reduced level of consciousness. On enquiry relatives gave history of fever, cough with expectoration since last 1 week. She is also a known case of some thyroid disorder. On presentation, her vital signs included a temperature of 31.2°C (88.2°F), heart rate of 46bpm and blood pressure of 110/86mmHg. What is the probable diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Myxedema coma

Clinical features shown in the figure are thin and brittle hair, loss of the lateral third of her eyebrows, macroglossia and doughy periorbital oedema – Suggests hypothyroidism.

•Myxedema coma

Severe hypothyroidism with seizure, decreased level of consciousness.

choices.text: Difficulty in concentrating and poor memory

questions.text: Which of the following is not associated with hypothyroidism:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Low cholesterol


Signs and symptoms of hypothyroidism in descending order of frequency

questions.text: The lab investigation of patient shows normal T4 and increased TSH. Correct diagnosis is:-
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Subclinical hypothyroidism

Subclinical hypothyroidism:(Elevated TSH, N-Free T4) Minor thyroid failure with compensatory increase in TSH.

questions.text: A 75-year-old lady with fracture neck of femur presents with two days history of altered sensorium and decreased urinary output. Serum calcium is 15.5 mg/dL, Urea is 140 mg/dL, Creatinine is 2 mg/dL. All of the following are useful for immediate management of hypercalcemia, except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Bisphosphonates

It inhibits breakdown of bone by inhibiting osteoclast cells.
